meanings.def: a separate room or area in a hospital for people with the same type of medical condition
examples: on the ward He worked as a nurse on the children's ward.
How many midwives are on the ward?
She spent five days in the maternity ward.
The doctor was doing her morning ward round.

meanings.def: (in the UK) one of the areas into which a city or town is divided and which elects and is represented by a member of the local council
a person, especially a child, who is under the legal protection of a court or another person (called a guardian)
examples: The child was made a ward of court.
